alert.note: Alert for Hocking (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 03 at 5:46PM EST by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 1230 AM EST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of Central Ohio, including the following county, Hocking. * WHEN...Until 1230 AM EST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 546 PM EST, local law enforcement reported minor flooding in High water on area roadways in southern Hocking County due to earlier rainfall. . - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Logan, Nelsonville, Hocking Hills State Park, Starr, Laurelville, Murray City, Adelphi, Ilesboro, Lake Logan State Park, Union Furnace, Gibisonville, Haydenville, South Bloomingville, Carbon Hill and Oreville.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. To report flooding, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
